configuration.label: Site logo
configuration.description: Company logo to be shown on all pages inside the documentation site. 200x30px .svg or .png is recommended.

configuration.label: Site favicon
configuration.description: Documentation site favicon. 32x32px .png is recommended, using legacy .ico is discouraged.

configuration.label: Accent color
configuration.description: Color for all links, selected, and active states. Default: #0f62fe

configuration.label: Accent Alt color
configuration.description: Used for hover states for links, selected, and active states. Usually slightly darker or lighter than Accent color. Default: #0043ce

configuration.label: Accent Surface color
configuration.description: Used for backgrounds of active and selected items. Should meet AA+ contract criteria against Accent color. Default: #ecf4ff

configuration.label: Custom font - Header
configuration.description: Fonts you want loaded into your site (e.g. for typography token previews). You can load multiple fonts at the same time.

configuration.label: Theme configuration
configuration.description: Overrides of CSS custom properties (variables) for the theme. You can use this to change the look and feel of the published documentation.

configuration.label: Icon stroke width
configuration.description: The width of the stroke width for all icons. Default: 2px

configuration.label: Custom CSS
configuration.description: If customizing look via built-in theme options is not enough, you can always add custom CSS. Custom CSS is injected last, overriding everything before it. It's at your own risk though since the CSS classes and DOM structure might change in the future.

configuration.label: Show bottom page navigation on homepage
configuration.description: When enabled, it will show bottom page navigation on the homepage.

configuration.label: Show Table of Content on homepage
configuration.description: When enabled, Table of Content will be displayed on homepage.

configuration.label: Override homepage label in menus
configuration.description: E.g. Home. When defined, it'll be used as a menu label for homepage in published documentation. This will allow you to have e.g. 'Welcome to our design system' as your page title for the homepage without displaying it in menus.

configuration.label: Overall style
configuration.description: Overal color style of top navigation in published documentation

configuration.label: Top navigation height (px)
configuration.description: If provided, top navigation will be this tall. Can't be smaller than 44px.

configuration.label: Show version dropdown
configuration.description: When enabled, version dropdown will be shown that allows readers to select which version of docs to read.

configuration.label: Show CTA in Site Header
configuration.description: When enabled, documentation will add CTA button into the top bar. CTA can lead to any link you provide.

configuration.label: Site CTA - Text
configuration.description: Label of the CTA button

configuration.label: Site CTA - URL to open
configuration.description: Link which will open when CTA button is clicked by the user

configuration.label: Site CTA - Open in new tab
configuration.description: When enabled, CTA url you provided will open in a new tab.

configuration.label: Show section label
configuration.description: When enabled, a section label will appear at the top of the left navigation.

configuration.label: Expand the first level of navigation
configuration.description: When enabled, all first-level groups will be expanded and the group label will be styled as eyebrow heading.

configuration.label: Page header default background image
configuration.description: If provided, the header background image for each page will use this image. You can still change the setting per-page.

configuration.label: Page header default background color
configuration.description: If provided, the header background color for each page will use this color. You can still change the setting per-page.

configuration.label: Page header default text color
configuration.description: If provided, the header text color for each page will use this color. You can still change the setting per-page.

configuration.label: Page header default height (px)
configuration.description: If provided, the header for each page will be this tall (px). You can still change the setting per-page. Use 0 to disable.

configuration.label: Page header style
configuration.description: If provided, the header for each page will be this tall (px). You can still change the setting per-page. Use 0 to disable.

configuration.label: Show Table of Content
configuration.description: When enabled, Table of Content will be displayed on each page.

configuration.label: Custom label for Table of Content
configuration.description: Customize the label of the Table of Content section on each page.

configuration.label: Hide H3 in Table of Contents
configuration.description: When enabled, Heading 3 level will be hidden in Table of Content.

configuration.label: Show bottom page navigation
configuration.description: When enabled, it will show bottom page navigation with quick links to next and previous pages.

configuration.label: Show footer
configuration.description: A small footer on each page will be displayed.

configuration.label: Show last published date
configuration.description: When enabled, last published date will be displayed in the footer.

configuration.label: Show custom footer
configuration.description: A custom footer will be added on top of the regular footer. Great for additional links, information, etc.

configuration.label: Custom footer HTML code
configuration.description: When footer is shown, the footer can be fully customized by changing its HTML representation. Add links, lines or even images, any html will work.
configuration.default:
My Doc Site

This footer can be completely changed through Supernova customization options. Head to site advanced customization to learn more!

configuration.label: Enable search engine indexing
configuration.description: When enabled, documentation site will be indexed by search engines. Note that only public documentation sites can be indexed.

configuration.label: Enable search engine link follow
configuration.description: When enabled, search robots will follow the links on the indexed pages.

configuration.label: Generate sitemap.xml
configuration.description: When enabled, documentation sitemap will be re-generated on every publish.

configuration.label: Site title prefix
configuration.description: When provided, page title will be prefixed with this string.

configuration.label: Google Analytics Measurement ID
configuration.description: Add Google Analytics tracking to your documentation site by providing a Measurement ID. You must set it up as Google Analytics 4 (recommended).

configuration.label: Intercom API key
configuration.description: Add Intercom to your documentation site by providing an API key.

configuration.label: Hotjar site ID
configuration.description: Add Hotjar to your documentation site by providing a Site ID.

configuration.label: Site title suffix
configuration.description: When provided, page title will be suffixed with this string.

configuration.label: Site title override
configuration.description: When provided, title will be completely overriden by this string for all site pages. Prefix is ignored in this case.

configuration.label: Site description prefix
configuration.description: When provided, page description will be prefixed with this string.

configuration.label: Site title suffix
configuration.description: When provided, page description will be suffixed with this string.
configuration.default: | Design system documentation, made with ❤️ using Supernova

configuration.label: Site description
configuration.description: When provided, page description will use this string. Otherwise, page description is generated dynamically from page subheading (if any) or its content.

configuration.label: Site Thumbnail Image
configuration.description: When provided, page description will use this string. Otherwise, site thumbnail is empty.

configuration.label: Editable React widgets
configuration.description: When React code widget is used, users can edit the code to see the components change in real-time.

configuration.label: Open in Codesandbox.io
configuration.description: When React code widget is used, users can open its code and play around with it in Codesandbox.io.

configuration.label: Include Lottie player
configuration.description: When enabled, Lottie Player will get enabled in your documentation. Notice: It'll add 250 Kb to your documentation initial page load.

configuration.label: Markdown private token
configuration.description: If provided, your markdown will authenticate using this token. Token can contain its type, format: ['basic' | 'Bearer' | 'token'] [token]. If not provided, 'token' is assumed.

configuration.label: Custom Head code
configuration.description: Any custom head code you want to inject into the head. You can inject new metatags, css or js using this method.

blocks.title: Markdown
blocks.description: Embed and process markdown from remote URL

blocks.title: Component Health
blocks.description: Show component health and additional attributes

blocks.title: Release Notes
blocks.description: Show formatted release notes from all previously released versions

blocks.title: Component Checklist
blocks.description: Highlight specific properties of your components

blocks.title: Component Overview Table
blocks.description: Show the overview of all of your components
